name: NPR
text:
The Ryder Cup and the Presidents Cup are postponing their event dates by a year due to the coronavirus pandemic.

This is the first rescheduling of the Ryder Cup since Sept. 11. 
https://t.co/Wruiez9H5N

name: NPR
text:
As a student, Dajae Williams came up with a better way to learn math —  rapping the quadratic formula or order of operations to make it more memorable.

Her love of math took her all the way to NASA.

Listen on #NPRShortWave ⤵️
https://t.co/PSofsFl5vA

name: NPR
text:
Republican Rep. Doug Collins has asked the DOJ to investigate what he calls "the egregious abuse of power" by the district attorney leading the prosecution of the white officers charged in the killing of Rayshard Brooks.
https://t.co/VfvskNeeYx

name: NPR
text:
Serbia is backtracking from plans to reinstate a curfew after demonstrators gathered to protest the coronavirus-prevention measure, some clashing with police and storming the parliament building.
https://t.co/3jlRPwn8EK

name: NPR
text:
The FBI is investigating after a Black man, Vauhxx Booker, says a group of white men beat him and threatened him with a noose at an Indiana state park on July 4.

After he reported the incident, officers did not make arrests, despite videos by witnesses.
https://t.co/0lSHU0DEO5
